pros: Really really low low pay
cons: Flexible time off really nice

pros: There was no pros that I would add here
cons: I think we spent more time visiting other departments than on training. Very limited training on the different programs. They hand you a stack of acronyms for the different programs. I needed hands on training to be effective at my job. The worst training I have ever had. Then they get upset if you ask questions.

review_title: Finally an increase in adjunct pay
pros: Nice faculty and staff - friendly place to be!
cons: Not a lot of “boots on the ground” kind of work going on to benefit the students.

pros: The benefits are pretty good There is allot of time off
cons: The University is pretty nice place to work - not really any cons

pros: Lots of students to teach and freedom to do research. Good retirement benefits.
cons: Organizational culture is extremely top-down. Thus, it's an organization that makes course corrections very slowly.

job_title: Assistant Director of Operations in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Great work location - Love the Tahlequah Area
cons: No living wage increase in 7 years Teachers are paid low, but NSU staff are paid lower.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Marketing in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Small class sizes, well qualified faculty, good student success resources, and great on-campus living.
cons: Limited research resources, sub-urban location

job_title: Maintenance Technician in Broken Arrow, OK
pros:
Great benefits 22 holidays 
Laidback atmosphere
cons: No raises, not enough staff to cover campus efficiently

job_title: IT Support Technician III in Tahlequah, OK
pros:
- Teams are highly social and everyone from the lowest to the highest works alongside each other in most departments.
- Leadership is typically good, your direct supervisors and managers will typically be good people.
- One of the best environments in town to work in, campus work is great.
cons:
- Administration is awful. The people at the top see everything else as a cost center despite pumping money into a ridiculous amount of unnecessary projects while doing nothing to solve foundational problems.
- Will likely fail in the years to come entirely. If the teachers are good they are being poached by colleges that pay more and care more, leading to lower quality classes, leading to less students enrolling, leading to less money, leading to teachers who are easily poached with higher pay, ad infinum.
- No raises. Your position makes a fixed amount and you will never earn more than that unless you change rolls. They know it leads to a high turnover and complain about it while implementing more policies that seem to promote high turnover.
- You will not make a difference. You could come up with the most amazing plan ever, and your department will love you, but the college will not change and will continue on the downward path that it has for years now. Just do some googling and see how bad it all is.

pros: Students are great! Some can be hard but most are wonderful and inspiring.
cons: Lack of support from uppers. Lots of micromanagement.

pros: School holidays are nice. Dept allowed flexible schedule.
cons: Low pay. Cannot survive without second job. Custodians make same amount (and they deserve each dime they make.) Both jobs deserve a raise.

pros:
Great working environment. 
Many opportunities to serve on committees and/or volunteer in community events.
Opportunities for advancement and lateral moves.
Supportive employees and mid level leadership.
cons:
Pay raises are almost non-existent and are not based on performance when given.
Top leadership lacks true working knowledge of many positions and areas within the university with no visible effort to make any changes to address it.

job_title: Professor of Management in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Opportunities to shine ... You can be a big fish in a small pond.
cons: Hard to get research support.

pros: Flexible Hours with Great Campus.
cons: Pay is minimum wage, but there isn’t much work to do, so it works if you have a busy schedule.

review_title: One of the best value for money institution
pros: Very well qualified faculty, focus on experential learning, great teaching aids and resources for students, three large campuses and online instruction, numerous sports and co-curricular activities, student-staff-facutly diversity, supporting learning environment and culture, great geographic location.
cons: Research resources for the faculty and salaries.

job_title: NSU ITS Student Worker in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Room for advancement, flexible schedule, good management
cons: The pay could be higher

job_title: Director of Business Affairs in Tulsa, OK
pros: Time off, the campus is amazing. Chick-fil-a
cons: Salary, culture, treatment of employees.

pros: Great population and disease diversity.
cons: I have learned a great amount at NSO OCO as a resident and would recommend the program to others.

review_title: They do not care about the staff.
pros: The students and faculty are great!
cons: They are not family friendly.

review_title: Rewards the lazy and sidelines the hard working
pros:
- Having a job on campus made it easier to get to on time
- They work with your schedule if you're taking classes
- You can take on a work study and pay off your tuition directly
cons:
- Desk monkeys are paid too much for how little they do and how much attitude you get
- Most of the hard working departments are sidelined and treated like crap
- Money at NSU seems to be handled VERY poorly–there is constant maintenance happening. I think NSU just hires out the cheapest option rather than shelling out money for a well done job. - You think I'm joking? They repaint the walls of the upper floors every year. That's how your tuition is spent.
- Why are the recycling bins placed 20 feet away from the nearest trashcan? I thought you were a "green" campus, or do you just mean your school colors?


Nutshell:
Almost every well-paying job in the main University Center building is sitting at the counters and doing homework on your laptop. This wouldn't be bad if these people had a better attitude, but the general mindset is a cross between bored student worker being paid to facebook and entitled desk monkey. Custodial, print shop, mail room, Activity Board, the Student Government Office, and the food courts are all super friendly and hard working but all the other departments are paid way too much for how little work they actually do.

job_title: Student Technical Consultant in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Friendly people all around, flexible work hours,
cons: pay is lacking and traveling to tickets can be tedious.

review_title: Office Aid Business and Tech Building
pros: Extremely Flexible and a Great Staff
cons: Low Pay, but that comes with the job

job_title: IT Support Technician in Tahlequah, OK
pros:
Good benefits. Healthcare is covered by the university (just for the employee, have to pay more to add family members) and you get a lot of time off for holidays and personal/vacation time. Employees also get half off tuition if they take classes here.

Very laid back atmosphere without a lot of expectations.
cons:
The laid back atmosphere has led to a lot of employees who do the bare minimum leaving those with a good work ethic to pick up the slack.

Management is hesitant to manage or discipline employees even when they make huge mistakes.

review_title: Northeastern State University is a great place to work and get a degree!
pros: NSU is not the biggest school in the state, but it's not the smallest either. The teacher-to-student ratio was perfect. Professors were really able to engage and teach the students in a perfect setting.
cons: With work study, you might not always have the best selection of jobs to choose from.

pros: I have worked with many great people at NSU. They are truly professionals in their field and most departments have great collegiality.
cons: Oklahoma legislature is dismal. Education is taking most of the hit from the budget crisis unfortunately. NSU is not immune to that.

review_title: Great for entry-level and part-time work!
pros: It was a nice environment to work in. Everybody is down to earth and has a good sense of humor. I worked in the Office of Student Affairs, where they take record-keeping very seriously, but the training process for that position enables you to get used to that.
cons: Supervisors can be anal about certain policies such as phone transfers and record-keeping, but all-in-all, they allow for growth in the position.

review_title: Of the three high education facilities I attended, NSU is the only one that did NOT fail me.
pros: Working on campus was the best part-time job I could have asked for while I was still a full-time student.
cons: The challenges I faced while working at NSU are the same challenges I would have faced with any job...keeping up with my school work and education while working.

review_title: Loved my job, no opportunity for advancement in my field”
job_title: Music Facilities Manager in Tahlequah, OK
pros: Great relationships with coworkers in my department, very autonomous work environment, managed my own schedule, learned quite a lot about music production and event planning/venue rentals, great benefits and vacation time
cons: Very irregular hours (but this was the nature of the responsibilities associated with the position), mediocre pay grade, And there was nowhere to advance in the realm of arts administration.

job_title: Assistant to Professor in Tahlequah, OK
pros: able to work around your class schedule and be very flexible. Also, allows you to become more acquainted with the teaching staff.
cons: very little pay, especially when you are only able to work part time. You might be financially better off waiting on tables.

review_title: Great University. A few things need to improve.
pros: Great immediate supervision. Fun atmosphere. Getting to stay connected to the college culture and atmosphere. Good benefits.
cons: Pay isn't great. Very few raises.

pros: I absolutely love this school. The people I work with have a passion for assisting students. There is always room for advancement. There is tuition assistance for full time employees and in my area, you are encouraged to further your education.
cons: I am not thinking of a con so I will leave this blank for the moment.

pros:
Professors are very helpful. Time is flexible and professors try to adjust the time with the GA. 
GA gets a scholarship which is tuition fees for 2 courses for that semester. That makes a huge difference!
cons: Pay is less than minimum. GA should be paid at least minimum wage. No benefits whatsoever

pros: Got to work on homework when there was nothing to do. When there was something to do it was usually easy tasks like making copies.
cons: They only offer you around 25 hours a week but for a college student it's perfect to have enough money to do stuff.

pros: Working with students, beautiful campus
cons: Many deans and professors are out-of-touch with the professions in which they teach.

pros:
Use of Gym and library 
Basic health package
cons: Its day shift vs night drama. No raise and no overtime. Supervisor dont support employees.

pros: I love the people, the administration, the work I do and most especially the Director of Human Resources.
cons: Low pay and I have to drive 35 miles to get here

review_title: Great place to work.  Easy to fit in.

pros: Nice people.  Good students who try hard.
